been composed in the Turkish campaign and was now being sung in Austria, the only change being that the words "Father Kdmenski" were replaced by "Father Kutiizov." 
Having jerked out these last words as soldiers do and waved his arms as if flinging something to the ground, the drummer a lean, handsome soldier of fortylooked sternly at the singers 
and screwed up his eyes. Then having satisfied himself that all eyes were fixed on him, he raised both arms as if carefully lifting some in-
